problem_names:
lemma actPres:
  fixes P    :: ccs
  and   Q    :: ccs
  and   Rel  :: "(ccs \<times> ccs) set"
  and   a    :: name
  and   Rel' :: "(ccs \<times> ccs) set"

  assumes "(P, Q) \<in> Rel"

  shows "\<alpha>.(P) \<leadsto>[Rel] \<alpha>.(Q)"

lemma sumPres:
  fixes P   :: ccs
  and   Q   :: ccs
  and   Rel :: "(ccs \<times> ccs) set"

  assumes "P \<leadsto>[Rel] Q"
  and     "Rel \<subseteq> Rel'"
  and     "Id \<subseteq> Rel'"

  shows "P \<oplus> R \<leadsto>[Rel'] Q \<oplus> R"

lemma parPresAux:
  fixes P   :: ccs
  and   Q   :: ccs
  and   Rel :: "(ccs \<times> ccs) set"

  assumes "P \<leadsto>[Rel] Q"
  and     "(P, Q) \<in> Rel"
  and     "R \<leadsto>[Rel'] T"
  and     "(R, T) \<in> Rel'"
  and     C1: "\<And>P' Q' R' T'. \<lbrakk>(P', Q') \<in> Rel; (R', T') \<in> Rel'\<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> (P' \<parallel> R', Q' \<parallel> T') \<in> Rel''"

  shows "P \<parallel> R \<leadsto>[Rel''] Q \<parallel> T"

lemma parPres:
  fixes P   :: ccs
  and   Q   :: ccs
  and   Rel :: "(ccs \<times> ccs) set"

  assumes "P \<leadsto>[Rel] Q"
  and     "(P, Q) \<in> Rel"
  and     C1: "\<And>S T U. (S, T) \<in> Rel \<Longrightarrow> (S \<parallel> U, T \<parallel> U) \<in> Rel'"

  shows "P \<parallel> R \<leadsto>[Rel'] Q \<parallel> R"

lemma resPres:
  fixes P   :: ccs
  and   Rel :: "(ccs \<times> ccs) set"
  and   Q   :: ccs
  and   x   :: name

  assumes "P \<leadsto>[Rel] Q"
  and     "\<And>R S y. (R, S) \<in> Rel \<Longrightarrow> (\<lparr>\<nu>y\<rparr>R, \<lparr>\<nu>y\<rparr>S) \<in> Rel'"

  shows "\<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>P \<leadsto>[Rel'] \<lparr>\<nu>x\<rparr>Q"

lemma bangPres:
  fixes P   :: ccs
  and   Rel :: "(ccs \<times> ccs) set"
  and   Q   :: ccs

  assumes "(P, Q) \<in> Rel"
  and     C1: "\<And>R S. (R, S) \<in> Rel \<Longrightarrow> R \<leadsto>[Rel] S"

  shows "!P \<leadsto>[bangRel Rel] !Q"

goal (1 subgoal):

using assms

proof (prove)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<alpha>.P \<leadsto>[Rel] \<alpha>.Q
by(fastforce simp add: simulation_def elim: actCases intro: Action)

goal (1 subgoal):

lemma parPresAux:
  fixes P   :: ccs
  and   Q   :: ccs
  and   Rel :: "(ccs \<times> ccs) set"

  assumes "P \<leadsto>[Rel] Q"
  and     "(P, Q) \<in> Rel"
  and     "R \<leadsto>[Rel'] T"
  and     "(R, T) \<in> Rel'"
  and     C1: "\<And>P' Q' R' T'. \<lbrakk>(P', Q') \<in> Rel; (R', T') \<in> Rel'\<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> (P' \<parallel> R', Q' \<parallel> T') \<in> Rel''"

  shows "P \<parallel> R \<leadsto>[Rel''] Q \<parallel> T"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<parallel> R \<leadsto>[Rel''] Q \<parallel> T
proof(induct rule: simI)

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>\<alpha> Q'.
       Q \<parallel> T \<longmapsto>\<alpha> \<prec> Q' \<Longrightarrow>
       \<exists>P'.
          P \<parallel> R \<longmapsto>\<alpha> \<prec> P' \<and>
          (P', Q') \<in> Rel''
case(Sim a QT)

this:
  Q \<parallel> T \<longmapsto>a \<prec> QT

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>\<alpha> Q'.

       \<exists>P'.
          P \<parallel> R \<longmapsto>\<alpha> \<prec> P' \<and>

proof (prove)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>P'.
       P \<parallel> R \<longmapsto>a \<prec> P' \<and> (P', QT) \<in> Rel''
proof(induct rule: parCases)

proof (state)
goal (3 subgoals):
 1. \<And>P'.
       Q \<longmapsto>a \<prec> P' \<Longrightarrow>
       \<exists>P'a.
          P \<parallel> R \<longmapsto>a \<prec> P'a \<and>
          (P'a, P' \<parallel> T) \<in> Rel''
 2. \<And>Q'.
       T \<longmapsto>a \<prec> Q' \<Longrightarrow>
       \<exists>P'.
          P \<parallel> R \<longmapsto>a \<prec> P' \<and>
          (P', Q \<parallel> Q') \<in> Rel''
 3. \<And>P' Q' aa.
       \<lbrakk>Q \<longmapsto>aa \<prec> P';
        T \<longmapsto>coAction aa \<prec> Q'; aa \<noteq> \<tau>;
        a = \<tau>\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>P'a.
                            P \<parallel>
                            R \<longmapsto>\<tau> \<prec> P'a \<and>
                            (P'a, P' \<parallel> Q') \<in> Rel''

lemma parPres:
  fixes P   :: ccs
  and   Q   :: ccs
  and   Rel :: "(ccs \<times> ccs) set"

  assumes "P \<leadsto>[Rel] Q"
  and     "(P, Q) \<in> Rel"
  and     C1: "\<And>S T U. (S, T) \<in> Rel \<Longrightarrow> (S \<parallel> U, T \<parallel> U) \<in> Rel'"

  shows "P \<parallel> R \<leadsto>[Rel'] Q \<parallel> R"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<parallel> R \<leadsto>[Rel'] Q \<parallel> R
using assms

proof (prove)
using this:
  P \<leadsto>[Rel] Q
  (P, Q) \<in> Rel

  (?S \<parallel> ?U, ?T \<parallel> ?U) \<in> Rel'

 1. P \<parallel> R \<leadsto>[Rel'] Q \<parallel> R
by(rule_tac parPresAux[where Rel''=Rel' and Rel'=Id]) (auto intro: reflexive)
